jparsec.io.image

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.image.Picture

  • public class Picture
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to read, write, and process images.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      The RGB components.

    • Field Detail

      • ALLOW_SPLINE_RESIZING

        public static boolean ALLOW_SPLINE_RESIZING
        Set this flag to true to allow spline resizing in method getScaledInstanceUsingSplines(int, int, boolean), that calls to the resize method using finite differences implemented in class Resize. This is the default value. Set this to false to force the multi step technique always, which is usually slightly worse, but much faster. In less words, this flag allows to force fast resizing mode in JPARSEC even when calling to the 'spline' resizing method.

      • PATTERN_SHARP

        public static final double[] PATTERN_SHARP
        A suitable pattern to produce a sharp effect.

      • PATTERN_IDENTITY

        public static final double[] PATTERN_IDENTITY
        A suitable pattern to produce an identity transformation.

      • PATTERN_BLUR

        public static final double[] PATTERN_BLUR
        A suitable pattern to produce a blur effect.

      • PATTERN_EDGE

        public static final double[] PATTERN_EDGE
        A suitable pattern to produce a edge detection effect.

      • PATTERN_SHARPENING

        public static final double[] PATTERN_SHARPENING
        A suitable pattern to produce a sharpening effect.

      • Picture

        public Picture(int[][][] array,
       boolean useAlpha)
        Constructor for an image given as an array. The image should be given with the red, green, blue, and alpha components (array size of 4, x, and y).
        Parameters:
        array - The array.
        useAlpha - True to use the alpha (transparency) channel. Note that selecting true could affect the JPEG export since JPEG format does not support it.

      • Picture

        public Picture(int[][] r,
       int[][] g,
       int[][] b,
       int[][] a)
        Constructor for an image given as 3 arrays of r, g, and b color maps. Array sizes should be the same for each of them.
        Parameters:
        r - The red color map.
        g - The green color map.
        b - The blue color map.
        a - The alpha color map. Set to null for a non transparent image.

      • Picture

        public Picture(byte[][] r,
       byte[][] g,
       byte[][] b,
       byte[][] a)
        Constructor for an image given as 3 byte arrays of r, g, and b color maps. Array sizes should be the same for each of them.
        Parameters:
        r - The red color map.
        g - The green color map.
        b - The blue color map.
        a - The alpha color map. Set to null for a non transparent image.

      • Picture

        public Picture(int[][] array)
        Constructor for an image given as a 2d array. The image should be given with ARGB colors.
        Parameters:
        array - The array, ordered as [x][y].

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String path_and_file_name)
           throws JPARSECException
        Writes an image to hard disk. Format is automatically taken from name extension (jpg, png, bmp, gif, and also eps, pdf, svg if dependencies are satisfied to export to these formats).
        Parameters:
        path_and_file_name - Path plus name of the image, including extension.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

                 throws JPARSECException
        Writes a JPEG image to hard disk, considering certain level of compression quality.
        Parameters:
        path_and_file_name - Path plus name of the image, including extension.
        quality - The output quality (0.0 to 1.0).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

                throws JPARSECException
        Writes a PNG image to hard disk, considering certain level of compression quality. PNG is lossless.
        Parameters:

        quality - The output quality (0.0 to 1.0).

        boolean v)
        Flips the image in horizontal and/or vertical.
        Parameters:

        v - True to flip vertically.

      • scaleImage

        public void scaleImage(int width,
              int height)
        Re-scales the image to another size. If it is desirable to re-scale just in one axis, adapting the other to maintain the original width/height ratio, then set the other length to zero. This method uses a multi-step technique.
        Parameters:
        width - New width.
        height - New height.
        See Also:
        Resize

      • scaleMaintainingImageRatio

        public void scaleMaintainingImageRatio(int width,
                              int height)
        Re-scales the image to another size, maintaining the original image width/height ratio. The result will be the smallest image compatible with the input size. Width or height can be set to 0 to calculate automatic value, but not both. This method uses a multi-step technique.
        Parameters:
        width - New width. Set to 0 or negative to calculate value automatically.
        height - New height. Set to 0 or negative to calculate value automatically.
        See Also:
        Resize

      • getScaledInstance

        public void getScaledInstance(int width,
                     int height,
                     boolean sameRatio)
        Scales the image to another size using the multi-step technique described in http://today.java.net/pub/a/today/2007/04/03/perils-of-image-getscaledinstance.html. Width or height can be set to 0 to calculate automatic value assuming that the same width/height ratio must be preserved.
        Parameters:
        width - Width. Set to 0 or negative to calculate value automatically.
        height - Height. Set to 0 or negative to calculate value automatically.
        sameRatio - True to maintain image ratio (maximum size that fits the rectangle with the provided width and height).

      • getScaledInstanceUsingSplines

        public void getScaledInstanceUsingSplines(int width,
                                 int height,
                                 boolean sameRatio)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Scales the image to another size using splines algorithm. Width or height can be set to 0 or negative to calculate automatic value assuming that the same width/height ratio must be preserved. Splines is the best possible down-scaling algorithm, giving very good results also when up-scaling, but it should be used with small images.
        Parameters:
        width - Width. Set to 0 to calculate value automatically.
        height - Height. Set to 0 to calculate value automatically.
        sameRatio - True to maintain image ratio (maximum size that fits the rectangle with the provided width and height).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
        See Also:
        Resize

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double ang,
          int radius_x,
          int radius_y)
        Rotates an image.
        Parameters:
        ang - Rotation angle in radians.
        radius_x - The translation/rotation radius in x, it will be usually the width of the image * 0.5.
        radius_y - The translation/rotation radius in y, it will be usually the height of the image * 0.5.

      • dispose

      • getImageAsArray

        public int[][][] getImageAsArray()
        Returns the image as an array. The array has 3 dimensions. The last two are the (x, y) position, while the first one has size 4 for each of the components: red, green, blue, and alpha colors.
        Returns:
        The array.

      • getImageAsArray

        public int[][] getImageAsArray(int component)
        Returns the image as an array. The array has 2 dimensions (x, y).
        Parameters:
        component - The component to return, from 0 (R) to 4 (A): RGBA.
        Returns:
        The array, or null if component is out of range.

      • getImageAsByteArray

        public byte[][] getImageAsByteArray(int component)
        Returns the image as an array. The array has 2 dimensions (x, y).
        Parameters:
        component - The component to return, from 0 (R) to 4 (A): RGBA.
        Returns:
        The array, or null if component is out of range.

      • getColorComponents

      • setAlphaChannel

        public void setAlphaChannel(int alpha,
                   boolean useMinValue)
        Sets the alpha channel for this image. The image should be transparent, if not you can use copyWithTransparency(BufferedImage).
        Parameters:
        alpha - The value of the alpha channel, 255 for opaque image, 0 for transparent.
        useMinValue - True to set the alpha value to the minimum value between the provided alpha value and the current alpha value of that pixel, false to set the absolute value of alpha to the provided value for all pixels, without considering the alpha of each pixel.

      • flatten

        public void flatten(java.awt.Color flatColor)
             throws JPARSECException
        Converts current image to flat version. Completely transparent colors will be changed to the input color.
        Parameters:
        flatColor - The color to set for transparent points.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

               boolean both)
                 throws JPARSECException

        Parameters:
        col0 - Initial color.
        col1 - New color.
        both - True to change also pixels with new color with the initial one.

        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        True of false.
        Throws:

      • makeTransparent

        public void makeTransparent(int transparencyLevel,
                   java.awt.Color transparentCol)
        Transforms the current image into transparent.
        Parameters:
        transparencyLevel - Transparency level, from 0 (invisible pixel) to 255 (full opaque pixel).
        transparentCol - The color to be modified to some level of transparency, or null to change the whole image.

      • makeTransparent

        public void makeTransparent(java.awt.Color c1,
                   java.awt.Color c2,
                   int t)
        Transforms the current image into transparent, for a given range of colors.
        Parameters:
        c1 - Color with the lowest values of the rgb components.
        c2 - Color with the highest values of the rgb components.
        t - Transparency level, 0 for fully transparent, 255 for opaque.

      • makeTransparent

        c2 - Color with the highest values of the rgb components.

      • createSVGPicture

        public static void createSVGPicture(java.lang.String file_name,
                    java.lang.Object instance,
                    java.lang.String method,
                    int w,
                    int h)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Creates an SVG file by calling a given generic drawing method.
        Parameters:
        file_name - The file name to create.
        instance - The instance will render the image.
        method - The name of the method that renders the image. This method must have only one input parameter: the Graphics2D drawing instance.
        w - The width of the output image.
        h - The height of the output image.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • adjustContrastAndBrightness

        public void adjustContrastAndBrightness(double scale,
                               double offset)
        Modifies the contrast and/or brightness of the image. To increase the contrast the usual way is to use a scale of 1.3 and to calculate the offset with the expression offset = 255 - 255 * scale.
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale factor, 1.0 to do nothing. It is a multiplication factor, use around 1.2 to increase contrast and obtain a visible effect. Can be lower than unity.
        offset - The brightness offset, use 0 to do nothing. It is an additive factor, use around 10 to increase brightness and obtain a visible effect. Can be negative.

      • removeAlpha

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage removeAlpha(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                       java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Removes the alpha channel of the image, setting transparent colors to a given color.
        Parameters:
        image - The input transparent image.
        fillColor - The color to fill transparent pixels.
        Returns:
        output image.

      • denoise

        public void denoise(int aggressive)
        Applies a median NEWS filter to remove noise. Based on code by John Burkardt. This method can be called few times to remove noise more effectively.
        Parameters:
        aggressive - Level of denoise intensity, from 0 to 2. The median is applied to a greater size around each pixel for level 2 (up to 21 pixels).

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
